faq.question: How do I get a Fumo?
answer: You have two main options: find a trustworthy
reseller at a reasonable price, or
order one from Gift directly using a
Proxy or Forwarding Service.
You may need to use both, depending on the reseller.

faq.question: What do I need in order to get a Fumo?
answer: The same things you need for any other online shopping:
<ul>
<li>A payment method - this means a credit or debit card. Gift itself does not
accept Paypal, but many storefronts do.
<li>Money - expect to spend between 50 and 200 USD, depending on the Fumo,
shipping costs, and source. Deka fumos range from $500 - $3000.
• Time - Shipping from overseas can take a long time.

faq.question: Which characters have Fumos?
answer: Check out our helpful Fumo Table.
You can also look through the entire Gift catalog here.

faq.question: What are the varieties of Fumo?
answer: <ul>
<li>Normal - a normal fumo. Typically about 20cm tall sitting.
Nendroid ones are taller and posable.
• Toy Strap - a small fumo with a strap for key chains.
<li>Deka - a giant fumo. 70cm tall and incredibly expensive. "Deka" comes from the Japanese
"dekai", meaning huge.
• Puppet - a hand puppet, about 40cm tall.

faq.question: How good are bootleg Fumos?
answer: Bootleg fumos, mimicking the Fumo style and passed off as being authentic, are often cheaper
than real ones. However, Some have their own character and value, like the long-legged
bootleg dekas, but many do not. You'll have to decide on your own, but know that you're taking
a risk. For information on avoiding bootlegs, see the reseller guide.

faq.question: I've seen Fumos that aren't listed!
answer: That was most likely a custom fumo! There are quite a few people out there who make custom fumos
themselves.

faq.question: What does "Fumo" mean?
answer: The word "Fumo" comes from the Japanese onomatopoeia "モフモフ" (mofumofu), which means "soft to the
touch", or "fluffy".

faq.question: Where can I find, meet, and/or discuss fumo with others?
answer: There are plenty of online communities for discussing and sharing our soft friends. /jp/ on 4chan regularly has
fumo related threads. /r/fumofumo on reddit also is a nice place to post fumos, and there are several fumo-related
Discord communities like Fumo Project: https://discord.gg/TyF7VKSwGZ.

faq.question: Fumo?
answer: Fumo.

forwarders.name: Blackship
forwarders.notes: There is an optional monthly subscription service and many optional features

forwarders.name: Japamart
forwarders.per_package: 5% + a commission based on total price - about $6 for a single Fumo
forwarders.notes: Does not accept forwards from auction sites; only accepts PayPal

forwarders.name: Tenso
forwarders.per_package: Based on weight - about ￥150 for a single Fumo

proxies.name: Buyee
proxies.other_fees: ￥200 per successful bid on Yahoo Auctions
proxies.consolidation: ￥500 for two packages or ￥1000 for 3 or more

proxies.name: From Japan
proxies.other_fees: ￥200 per successful bid on Yahoo Auctions

proxies.name: Japamart
proxies.per_order: 5% + $2 + a commission based on total price, about $10 for a single Fumo
proxies.other_fees: Some shenanigans if multiple Japamart users bid on the same item
proxies.sniper_bids: Not specified, but near auction close

proxies.name: Kuboten
proxies.notes: Suggests placing orders 12 hours before auctions close

proxies.name: Noppin
proxies.other_fees: Additional charges based on size and weight; 3.5% money transfer fee

proxies.name: Treasure Japan
proxies.per_order: Rates vary by price range and weight; minimum ￥700.
proxies.notes: Estimated total fee for a single Fumo is around 10%

storefronts.name: Gift Online Shop
desc: The source of all Fumos. Prices are always cheapest here.
The most popular Fumos tend to sell out in an hour or less.
Proxies are often too slow, or sometimes reach order limits.

storefronts.name: Suruga-ya
desc: Second-hand retailer of lots of hobby goods.
Will nearly always have Fumos in stock.
Prices vary wildly but tend to be a bit more expensive than Gift's.
Also has an English storefront.

storefronts.name: Mandrake
desc: Sells preowned hobby goods.
Fumos here tend to sell very quickly.
This is a digital storefront for physical stores, so staff has to confirm that nobody has bought your item before you can pay.

storefronts.name: Amazon Japan
desc: It's Amazon but in Japanese.
Fumos are rarely listed here and are usually very expensive.

storefronts.name: SolarisJapan
desc: English storefront for Japanese figures and merchandise.
Prices are very high.

storefronts.name: Goods Republic
desc: English storefront for Japanese figures and merchandise.
Prices are very high.
Although the site is in English, searches still need to be in Japanese.

storefronts.name: JPFigures
desc: Literally a scam. Do not purchase anything from them.
They have a nice looking webpage. Don't be fooled.
The link above is a rickroll.

auction_houses.name: Yahoo Auctions JP
desc: Basically Japanese eBay. Every proxy can interact with it.
Always has Fumos listed, and mostly at reasonable prices.
Just like eBay, you can be sniped or outbid.
Some sellers have blacklisted some proxies.

auction_houses.name: Mercari
desc: No auctions, just direct sales.
Often has individual and group batches of fumos.
Proxies can be too slow for some of the quicker deals.

auction_houses.name: Rakuten
desc: A storefront for both corporations and individual sellers.
When searching, use 東方ぬいぐるみ (Touhou Plush) not 東方ふもふも (Touhou Fumo).
Prices might be fair for newer Fumos, but are very expensive for older ones.
